fields.title: Harris 1984 Presidential Election Survey, study no. 842107

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue:
This survey focused on the presidential candidates and related issues

"Questions included affirmative action programs; air and water pollution; federal environmental policies; ERA; nuclear freeze; federal deficit; rating of Mondale, Reagan, Congressman Thomas P. ""Tip"" O'Neil; war between Iraq and Iran; US in the Persian Gulf; crime rate; law enforcement; and violence on TV."

fields.notesText: Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Harris telephone surveys use a form of random digit dialing. Interviewers are usually given the first five digits of a series of randomly selected residential telephone numbers that have previously been stratified by geographic locations, including minor civil divisions. The interviewers then add two randomly generated digits to complete a new seven-digit number; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:ACCESS.CATEGORY  Notes: I; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:CODEBOOK.NUMBER  Notes: H-842107;
